description: From French facétieux, from Latin facētia (“jest, wit, humor”), from facētus (“witty, jocose, facetious”).

adjectives.description: facetious (comparative more facetious, superlative most facetious)

entries.meaning: Treating serious issues with (often deliberately) inappropriate humour; flippant.
examples: Robbie's joke about Heather's appearance was just him being facetious.

entries.meaning: Of an idea or statement, humorously silly or counterproductive for the purpose of sarcastically advocating the opposite.
